verses.roman:
kecit kurvanti karmāṇi
kāmair ahata-cetasaḥ
tyajantaḥ prakṛtīr daivīr
yathāhaṁ loka-saṅgraham

synonyms: kecit—some people; kurvanti—execute; karmāṇi—worldly duties; kāmaiḥ—by desires; ahata—undisturbed; cetasaḥ—whose minds; tyayantaḥ—giving up; prakṛtīḥ—propensities; daivīḥ—created by the Supreme Lord's material energy; yathā—as; aham—I; loka-saṅgraham—to instruct the people in general.
translation: Having renounced all material propensities, which spring from the Lord's illusory energy, some people execute worldly duties with their minds undisturbed by mundane desires. They act as I do, to instruct the general populace.
